name: floating collar net cage for aquaculture 25 m construction and maintenance | floating collar cage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18841/documentation

This activity presents data from the Agrinatura VCA4D project. Floating collar cage for aquaculture, 25 m diameter, Scandinavian design, used worldwide for salmonids, cichlids, etc. Used in lakes and marine environments. This process may be used to model different sizes of floating collar cages (range from 22 to 100 m diameter, http://aqualine.no).

Construction and maintenance of a floating cage system, expressed either in terms of its diameter (if floating collar) or side length (if hexagonal cage), with their associated lifetimes. The specific fish holding capacity of each system is expressed as well per m of diameter or side length.


The construction and EOL are related to the production means for cagesThe construction and EOL are related to the production means for cages.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/032:Aquaculture

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology described in Vázques-Olivares A.E., 2003, DESIGN OF A CAGE CULTURE SYSTEM FOR FARMING IN MEXICO. UNU Fisheris Training Programme, Final Project. Confirmed by observations at large cage culture systems in Kariba lake, Zambia (project DGDEVCO/VCA4D, 2017). Lifetime: 10 years (structure) and 2 years (nets)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Escandinavian-designed floating collar cages, used across the world (known examples in Nordic seas, African lakes and Chilean coastlines), were asumed to represent the most common type of floating collar cages used worldwide for lake and sea aquaculture.

exchanges.description: Floating collar net cage for lake and marine aquaculture. Diameter: 25 m, weight: 6 000 kg, fish capacity: 70 000 kg

flow.name: floating collar cage
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/032:Aquaculture
